pullRequest.body:
And proves some lemmas about them. This is a first step to start porting the material of the `SimpleGraph` part of the library into `Digraph`s.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

nodes.body:
### PR summary [316d45d524](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/16954/commits/316d45d524e067cc9a30e57d7caee6560d5c6e99)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Combinatorics.Digraph.Orientation`|502|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ toSimpleGraphInclusive`
`+ toSimpleGraphInclusive_bot`
`+ toSimpleGraphInclusive_mono`
`+ toSimpleGraphInclusive_top`
`+ toSimpleGraphStrict`
`+ toSimpleGraphStrict_bot`
`+ toSimpleGraphStrict_mono`
`+ toSimpleGraphStrict_subgraph_toSimpleGraphInclusive`
`+ toSimpleGraphStrict_top`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

@YaelDillies I admit that the structure of digraphs is too simple, but I think having `Digraph`s is good, because it sets up the ground to talk about properties of many interesting subclasses of `Digraph`s, such as tournaments. What do you think?

> Sorry, I'm as of yet unconvinced that `Digraph` deserves to be a thing as opposed to just using `V â†’ V â†’ Prop`ðŸ˜…

I would say that it deserves a name at least as much as `SimpleGraph` which is certainly less simple but OTOH is a bit arbitrary (as opposed to a pair `Digraph` / `IsSimple`).
maintainer merge
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by YaelDillies.

:v: Rida-Hamadani can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11672870982/job/32502391188)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11672870982/job/32502391689)
Sorry, I'm as of yet unconvinced that `Digraph` deserves to be a thing as opposed to just using `V â†’ V â†’ Prop`ðŸ˜…
bors d+

```suggestion
  Adj v w := G.Adj v w âˆ§ G.Adj w v
```
is equivalent, maybe you prefer that
Consider the case where `u` and `v` are the same vertex, and it has a self-loop, then the two statements would be different.
You don't need to prevent loops explicitly, see what happens when `v = w` in the definition.
Isn't this mostly an iff? Up to self-loops.
Good point, thanks!
I'm not really convinced by the usefulness of this section. `G.Adj` already does everything we want. Do you think you could split this half off to a later PR?
To make sure, you mean from line 124 to line 143?
No, all I have selected in this comment, so from L. 91 to L.143
Do you think you could find more semantic names for these two operations?
What do you think of `toSimpleGraphFromEitherEdge` and `toSimpleGraphFromBothEdges`? Or maybe `toSimpleGraphInclusive` and `toSimpleGraphStrict`?
Maybe the latter yes
I think all of these should be `simp`
I tried using `simp` but it did not work for any :(
Oh, I mean the lemmas should be marked as simp; rather than the proof being simp here
We should also give lemmas for how these operations relate to other lattice structures on graphs and digraphs. Feel free to leave this as a TODO in the file.
I started with writing these lemmas then felt like it will complicate the review process significantly, so I'll write a TODO now, and open a different PR with those lemmas later.
These are no longer in the file.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Combinatorics/SimpleGraph): conversions between `SimpleGraph` and `Digraphs`
